intro: Corynostylis longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-pedicelled corynostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and distinctive, spurred flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
